snippet.textDisplay: I have thin hair strands, but a lot of it and it's curly with frizz. With products and blow drying beforehand (I blow out my hair until straight), it takes me an hour to straighten to last days. If i take 30 minutes only, my hair will puff out once I get outside. But 30 minutes is understandable for people with already kind of straight hair.
snippet.textOriginal: I have thin hair strands, but a lot of it and it's curly with frizz. With products and blow drying beforehand (I blow out my hair until straight), it takes me an hour to straighten to last days. If i take 30 minutes only, my hair will puff out once I get outside. But 30 minutes is understandable for people with already kind of straight hair.

Brad: An hour and a half is too long . No matter how crazy or long your hair is.

Watches intensely for the answer

snippet.textDisplay: I have the airwrap and I find there is improvements they should do to it....I gave up curling my hair with it and only use the flat brush (which has no grip & needs improvement) or with no attachments to lightly dry it befor using the brush. For the price they want for this new one...... no thank you. I have a cordless flat iron I picked up years ago and that’s good enough if I’m somewhere with no power. For more regular use I would not be happy with the creases and heavy weight.
snippet.textOriginal: I have the airwrap and I find there is improvements they should do to it....I gave up curling my hair with it and only use the flat brush (which has no grip & needs improvement) or with no attachments to lightly dry it befor using the brush. For more regular use I would not be happy with the creases and heavy weight.

snippet.textDisplay: You should try the flat iron "Pretty in a Minute" When I was in cosmetology school I bought the whole kit. I would like to know what you think of it. It came with clippers, blow dryer, flat iron, curling iron with 3 different wands. They showed us that you could actually leave the iron on the hair and it wouldn't damage the hair. He did a demonstration and left the iron on a girls hair for five minutes. We were all scared at this point thinking her hair was about to fall off. I've been using it for a couple years now and I believe my hair feels better but I also have deal with it every day. Anywayyy this is the website. https://prettyinaminute.com
snippet.textOriginal: You should try the flat iron "Pretty in a Minute" When I was in cosmetology school I bought the whole kit. I would like to know what you think of it. It came with clippers, blow dryer, flat iron, curling iron with 3 different wands. They showed us that you could actually leave the iron on the hair and it wouldn't damage the hair. He did a demonstration and left the iron on a girls hair for five minutes. We were all scared at this point thinking her hair was about to fall off. I've been using it for a couple years now and I believe my hair feels better but I also have deal with it every day. Anywayyy this is the website. https://prettyinaminute.com

snippet.textDisplay:
i'm almost 23. when i was 12 i bought a philips straightner for my birthday that cost me like 100$.
i still use it till this day and it's AWESOME!
don't buy those expensive shitty ones! just buy a good one!
also-sorry brad but if i buy a 500$ straightner-i'd expect it to be PERFECT! and that's not the case here..
